testcase.classname: Given the createMachine factory when passing invalid configuration
testcase.name: should throw errors if state or transitions are missing

testcase.classname: Given the createMachine factory when we create a machine without a name
testcase.name: it should automatically generate a name and allow the creation

testcase.classname: Given the createMachine factory when we create a machine without a state
testcase.name: it should throw an error

testcase.classname: Given the createMachine factory when we create a machine using the shorter syntax
testcase.name: it should create a working machine

testcase.classname: Given the createMachine factory when we dispatch an action
testcase.name: it should handle the action

testcase.classname: Given the createMachine factory when we dispatch an action
testcase.name: it should handle the action implemented as arrow function

testcase.classname: Given the Stent library when creating a new machine
testcase.name: should have the machine with its name set up

testcase.classname: Given the Stent library when creating a new machine and we have a middleware attached
testcase.name: should trigger the middleware hook

testcase.classname: Given the Stent library when creating a new machine and we have a middleware attached
testcase.name: should call the onMiddlewareRegister hook if available

testcase.classname: Given the Stent library when `getting a machine
testcase.name: should return the machine if it exists

testcase.classname: Given the Stent library when `getting a machine
testcase.name: should throw an error if the machine does not exist

testcase.classname: Given the Stent library when creating a machine without a name
testcase.name: should be possible to fetch it by using the machine itself or the its generated name

testcase.classname: Given the Stent library when we fire two actions one after each other and we use the .latest version of the action
testcase.name: should cancel the first action and only work with the second one

testcase.classname: Given the Stent library when using the `destroy` method
testcase.name: should delete the machine

testcase.classname: Given the Stent library when using the `destroy` method and the machine does not exist
testcase.name: should throw an error

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when using connect
testcase.name: should allow mapping to machines

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when using connect
testcase.name: should add only one middleware

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when using connect and when we update the state of the mapped machine/s
testcase.name: should fire the mapping function

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when using connect and we use `mapOnce`
testcase.name: should fire the mapping only once

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when using connect and we use `mapSilent`
testcase.name: should fire the mapping only when the machine changes its state

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when using connect and we pass no mapping function
testcase.name: should still do the connecting

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when using connect and we have two mappers
testcase.name: should call them only if the machine that they are connected transitions

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when using connect and we have a middleware attached
testcase.name: should call the proper middleware hook

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when using connect and we destroy a machine
testcase.name: should remove the machine from any mapping

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when we use the `disconnect` function
testcase.name: should detach the mapping

testcase.classname: Given the connect helper when we use the `disconnect` function and we have a middleware attached
testcase.name: should call the proper middleware hook

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when we add a handler which is not expected
testcase.name: should throw an error

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when dispatching an action which is missing in the current state
testcase.name: should silently do nothing and NOT throw an error (handleAction returns false)

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when there is nothing for the current state
testcase.name: should return false

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when we transition to a state which has no actions or it is undefined
testcase.name: should throw an error if there is no such a state defined

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when we transition to a state which has no actions or it is undefined
testcase.name: should throw an error if there the state has no actions inside

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a string
testcase.name: should change the state of the machine to that string

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is an object
testcase.name: should change the state of the machine to that object

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a function
testcase.name: should call the handler with the machine and the given payload

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a function
testcase.name: should update the state

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a function
testcase.name: should update the state even if a string is returned

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator
testcase.name: should change the state if we return a string

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator
testcase.name: should change the state if we yield a primitive

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator
testcase.name: should change the state if we yield an object

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator and we use the call helper
testcase.name: should execute the function

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator and we use the call helper
testcase.name: should execute the function and return the result if any

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator and we use the call helper
testcase.name: should execute the function with proper parameters

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator and we use the call helper and when the function returns a promise
testcase.name: should return the value of the resolved promise

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator and we use the call helper and when the function returns a promise
testcase.name: should throw an error if the promise is rejected

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator and we use the call helper when the function returns another generator
testcase.name: should iterate through that inner generator

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when the handler is a generator and we use the call helper when the function returns another generator
testcase.name: should handle errors properly through the generator chain

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when we have middlewares registered
testcase.name: should fire the middleware/s if an action is dispatched and after that

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when we have middlewares registered
testcase.name: should pass the machine as context

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when we have middlewares registered
testcase.name: should skip to the next middleware if there is no appropriate hook defined

testcase.classname: Given the handleAction function when we have middlewares registered
testcase.name: should fire the middleware/s when the state is changed

testcase.classname: Given the handleActionLatest helper and we fire same action twice within the same state
testcase.name: should kill the first generator and its processes leaving only the new one working

testcase.classname: Given the handleGenerator helper when we run the same generator again and we want to cancel the first one
testcase.name: should cancel the second generator

testcase.classname: Given the registerMethods helper when registering methods
testcase.name: should create methods dynamically (based on states and actions)

testcase.classname: Given the registerMethods helper when registering methods
testcase.name: should dispatch an action with the given payload

testcase.classname: Given the registerMethods helper when registering methods
testcase.name: should check if the machine is in a particular state

testcase.classname: Given the registerMethods helper when registering methods
testcase.name: should check if particular transition is allowed

testcase.classname: Given the registerMethods helper when registering methods when some of the transitions match the word `name`, `transition` or `state`
testcase.name: should throw an error if name is used

testcase.classname: Given the registerMethods helper when registering methods when some of the transitions match the word `name`, `transition` or `state`
testcase.name: should throw an error if transitions is used

testcase.classname: Given the registerMethods helper when registering methods when some of the transitions match the word `name`, `transition` or `state`
testcase.name: should throw an error if state is used

testcase.classname: Given the registerMethods helper when registering methods when some of the transitions match the word `name`, `transition` or `state`
testcase.name: should throw an error if destroy is used

testcase.classname: Given the toCamelCase helper when using toCamelCase
testcase.name: should transform "run" to "run"

testcase.classname: Given the toCamelCase helper when using toCamelCase
testcase.name: should transform "a b" to "aB"

testcase.classname: Given the toCamelCase helper when using toCamelCase
testcase.name: should transform "a b c" to "aBC"

testcase.classname: Given the toCamelCase helper when using toCamelCase
testcase.name: should transform "the answer is 42" to "theAnswerIs42"

testcase.classname: Given the toCamelCase helper when using toCamelCase
testcase.name: should transform "Hello World" to "helloWorld"

testcase.classname: Given the toCamelCase helper when using toCamelCase
testcase.name: should transform "get-data-from-there" to "getDataFromThere"

testcase.classname: Given the toCamelCase helper when using toCamelCase
testcase.name: should transform "another_mixed example-of^% a method" to "another_mixedExampleOfAMethod"

testcase.classname: Given the toCamelCase helper when using toCamelCase
testcase.name: should transform "startProcess" to "startProcess"

testcase.classname: Given the toCamelCase helper when using toCamelCase
testcase.name: should transform "start Pro ceSs" to "startProCeSs"

testcase.classname: Given the validateConfig helper function when validating config
testcase.name: should throw errors if state or transitions are missing

testcase.classname: Given the validateState helper when using validateState
testcase.name: throw an error if the state has no "name" property inside

testcase.classname: Given the Logger middleware when using Logger with function and string as a handler
testcase.name: should log to the console

testcase.classname: Given the Logger middleware when using the Logger with a generator function
testcase.name: should log every step of the generator

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper when connecting a component
testcase.name: should call our mapping function

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper when connecting a component
testcase.name: should map machines state and actions properly

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper when connecting a component
testcase.name: should get re-rendered if a machine's state is changed

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper when connecting a component
testcase.name: should NOT get re-rendered if mapped with `mapOnce`

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper when connecting a component when we update the state of the machine many times in a single frame
testcase.name: should trigger the mapping function many times

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper when unmounting the component
testcase.name: should detach from the machines

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper when we connect without mapping
testcase.name: should detach from the machines

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper when we use mapSilent
testcase.name: should only call the mapping function when the machine changes its state

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper and we have a middleware attached
testcase.name: should call the proper hooks

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper and we have a middleware attached and we destroy a machine
testcase.name: should call the proper hooks

testcase.classname: Given the connect React helper and the problem described in issue #13
testcase.name: should map the transition handler properly
